questions.question: What is the main principle of Object-Oriented Programming?
Which keyword is used to create a class in JavaScript?
What do we call a blueprint for creating objects?
What is it called when a class inherits properties and methods from another class?
Which of the following is NOT a feature of OOP?
What is polymorphism?
options: Ability to use the same method in different ways

questions.question: What is the purpose of constructors in OOP?
What keyword is used to access the properties of the current object in a class?
What is the term for a class that cannot be instantiated?
Which of the following best describes encapsulation?
options: Combining data and methods in a single unit
Hiding the implementation details from the user
Creating a new version of a method
